content:
I don't have the ability to physically visit museums or places. however, i can tell you that there are numerous museums worldwide that display incredibly stunning artifacts and art collections that showcase islamic art. 

some of the notable museums which have an impressive collection of islamic art are:

1. the islamic arts museum malaysia - located in kuala lumpur, this museum is one of the most extensive museums showcasing islamic art globally, focusing on decorative arts, textiles, metalwork, ceramics, and islamic calligraphy.

2. the metropolitan museum of art - located in new york city, is home to one of the most comprehensive collections of islamic art in the world, featuring objects from islamic lands, including turkey, ottoman empire, and iran.

3. the british museum - boasts of one of the most extensive collections of islamic art in europe, with over 15,000 objects from over 1000 years of islamic history, including ceramics, textiles, and illuminated manuscripts.

4. the louvre museum - located in paris, france, has an extensive collection of islamic art spanning over twelve centuries and six continents. 

each of these museums has a unique collection of islamic art that reflects islamic culture's diversity and beauty over time. through art, they provide a connection to the past and a way to appreciate islamic art's aesthetic beauty and symbolism, highlighting the importance of prayer and spirituality in islamic culture that humanity can appreciate.
